conclusion: Determine the propagation time of light in the prism using properties of the isosceles prism and geometry.
Identify given information: vertex angle of prism is 30°, side length AB is L, light hits midpoint O of AB, incident angle is 45°, propagation speed of light in vacuum is C.
Length of DO is equal to length of AB, therefore DO = L.
Calculate angle OAB as 30° - 45° = -15°, assume angle OAB is 180° - 15° = 165°.
Angle OAB is equal to vertex angle 30°.
